data.title: L'Immagine Ritrovata
meta_keywords: l'immagine ritrovata film digital restoration laboratory
data.text:
L’Immagine Ritrovata and L’Image Retrouvée are attending the Marché du Film Classique at the Festival Lumière in Lyon with a own booth in the exhibition area (October 15th – 18th 2019).

We’ll be also present at Festival Lumière with the following restored title:

THE LOVERS OF VERONA [Les Amants de Vérone] (André Cayatte, 1949, 1h45)

Cinéma Comoedia, Sun. 13 - 11.15am

Restored for Pathé Films

THE WHEEL [La Roue] (Abel Gance, 1923, 6h53)

Auditorium of Lyon, Sat.19 - 10am (Part 1, 3h46) |Sun.20 - 10am (Part 2, 3h07)

Restored for Fondation Jérôme Seydoux-Pathé in collaboration with Pathé Films, Cinémathèque Française, Cinémathèque Suisse

MIRACLE IN MILAN [Miracolo a Milano] (Vittorio De Sica, 1951, 1h36)

Lumière Terreaux, Sun.13 - 11am | Institut Lumière (Theatre 1), Tue.15 - 11am | Lumière Fourmi, Wed. 16 - 9pm

Restored for Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and Compass Film

THE HOUSE IS BLACK [Khaneh siah ast] (Forough Farrokhzad,1963, 20min)

THE HILLS OF MARLIK [Tappeh haye Marlick] (Ebrahim Golestan, 1963, 15min)

Villa Lumière Tue.15, 4pm | Lumière Fourmi, Wed.16, 2:30pm

Restored for Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and Ecran Noir Productions in collaboration with Ebrahim Golestan.

SWORDS OF BLOOD [Cartouche] (Philippe de Broca, 1962, 1h54)

UGC Confluence, Sun.13, 11am | Pathé Bellecour, Tue.15, 7pm | Ciné Caluire,

Sat.19, 8:30pm

Restored for STUDIOCANAL

FLOWERS OF SHANGHAI [Hai shang hua] (Hou Hsiao-Hsien, 1998, 1h54)

Lumière Terreaux Sun.13, 8:15pm | Lumière Fourmi, Fri.18, 8:15pm

Restored for Shanghai International Film Festival in collaboration with Shochiku Co. and 3H Production

FISTS IN THE POCKET [I pugni in tasca] (Marco Bellocchio, 1965, 1h45)

Lumière Terreaux, Tue.15, 2:45pm | Lumière Bellecour, Thu.17, 9:30pm | UGC Astoria, Sat.19, 8:30pm

Restored for Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and Kavak Film

THE CONJUGAL BED [Una storia moderna - L'ape regina] (Marco Ferreri, 1963, 1h35)

Lumière Fourmi, Sun.13, 9:45pm | Villa Lumière, Fri.18, 7:30pm | Lumière Terreaux, Sun. 20, 11am

Restored for Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and TF1 Studio

SHORT FILMS (Emile Cohl, 1908-1910, 1h10)

Villa Lumière, Wed.16, 9:30am | Institut Lumière, Thu.17, 1pm

Restored for Gaumont

THE BROKEN BUTTERFLY (Maurice Tourneur, 1919, 58min)

Institut Lumière, Wed.16, 2pm | Pathé Bellecour, Sat.19, 2:45pm

Restored for The Film Foundation in association with Fondation Jérôme Seydoux-Pathé

TONI (Jean Renoir, 1935,1h22)

Pathé Bellecour, Sun.13, 2:45pm | Institut Lumière, Mon.14, 2:30pm | Comoedia, Fri.18, 8:15pm

Restored for Gaumont

CHARLIE CHAPLIN SHORTS

THE IMMIGRANT (Charlie Chaplin, 1917, 24min)

THE FLOORWALKER (Charlie Chaplin, 1916, 28min)

THE ADVENTURER (Charlie Chaplin, 1917, 26min)

Halle Tony Garnier, Sun.13, 3pm

Restored for Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and Lobster Films

The full programme is available online at Festival Lumière.

As part of the 76th Venice International Film Festival, the Venice Classics Award for Best Restored Film went to Extase (Ecstasy) (Gustav Machatý, Czechoslovakia, 1932). The restoration, supervised by Národní filmový archiv (Prague) and supported by Karlovy Vary International Film Festival, was carried out by L'Immagine Ritrovata.

It is the fifth film restored by L'Immagine Ritrovata to win the Venice Classics Award. In 2016, the award for best restored film went to Break Up – L’uomo dei cinque palloni (Marco Ferreri, Italy/France, 1963/1967), in 2015 to Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom (Pier Paolo Pasolini, Italy, 1975), in 2014 to A Special Day (Ettore Scola, Italy/France, 1977) and in 2013 to Property Is No Longer a Theft (Elio Petri, Italy/France, 1973).

From June 23rd to 30th, Cineteca di Bologna hosts the 33nd edition of Il Cinema Ritrovato film festival, 8 days of screenings and meetings in five theatres, as well as open air evening screenings in Bologna’s wonderful main square, Piazza Maggiore, and in Cineteca’s courtyard called Piazzetta Pasolini.

A selection of the very best restorations realized over the year by public and private institutions will be presented both in 35mm and digital formats during the festival. Among these, several films recently restored at L’Immagine Ritrovata.

Find out the full programme of Il Cinema Ritrovato.

L'immagine Ritrovata had the honour of accepting, on behalf of Cineteca di Bologna, this year's prestigious FOCAL Award for the Best Archive Restoration/Preservation Title for the restoration of Pixote: A Lei do Mais Fraco (H.Babenco, Brazil, 1981). The restoration work was commisioned by the WCF and George Lucas Family Foundation.

In the last two decades Pixote has only been available on scratched and worn-out 35mm prints. Pixote was restored using the original camera negatives and first generational internegatives preserved at the Cinemateca Brasileira. In order to minimise the overall presence of mold, the camera negative was wet-gate scanned at 4K resolution, and digitally restored, requiring significant effort.

The annual FOCAL International Awards ceremony was held on June 20th, 2019.
